dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The one story ranch house sits surrounded by other middle class abodes. A sedan pulls into the driveway and the driver, TOM NEWMA gets out and walks into the house.

dialogues.speaker: INVITATION
dialogues.text: A simple invitation reads: "ST. MARY'S HIGH SCHOOL welcom the class of '87 for their 10 year class reunion."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The kitchen appears neat and clean but nothing fancy. ROSE-MARIE NEWMAN (ROSE) sits at the kitchen table lookin the invitation. Rose, twenty-eight years old, Italian- Catholic, wears a drab business suit. The off screen sound of the front door closing and Tom enters.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: You ready?

dialogues.speaker: ROSE
dialogues.text: I'm waiting for you. Tom's an accountant and looks like it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rose stands in front of the mirror modeling a pair of jea

dialogues.speaker: ROSE
dialogues.text: I want to go to the beach, too. You think you could call Sarah and tell her I'm sick? Tom stands by the closet, in his boxer shorts, putting hi slacks carefully on a hanger. He's still wearing his shir and tie.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Yeah, what do you want me to say? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca

dialogues.speaker: ROSE
dialogues.text: That woman'll believe anything. Just tell her I have the flu. Rose stares at herself in the mirror.

dialogues.speaker: ROSE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Do these jeans make me look fat?

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: ROSE
dialogues.text: Yes, they do.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: No, they don't. You look great. Tom kisses Rose on the forehead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rose and Tom prepare the bed for their guests.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: I'm really looking forward to this weekend.

dialogues.speaker: ROSE
dialogues.text: Yeah well, it's just going to be a big headache for me.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: No it's not.

dialogues.speaker: ROSE
dialogues.text: You know, you could have just told him to stay at a hotel. It's not like he can't afford it.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: It's going to be fun.

dialogues.speaker: ROSE
dialogues.text: That's Jacob talking, not you. You've got to stop letting people put words in your mouth. Rose snaps the sheet into place and moves to prepare the of the bedding.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: I know, but-- (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca

dialogues.speaker: ROSE
dialogues.text: --Sure, it's fun for him, but I'm the one that gets stuck doing all the work.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: I know.

dialogues.speaker: ROSE
dialogues.text: --It's a lot of work getting the house ready for guests. Cooking and cleaning and I have to go shopping...

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: --I know.

dialogues.speaker: ROSE
dialogues.text: --and then when they all leave I have to wash all the sheets and clean up after everyone. Tom moves to Rose and kisses her on the forehead.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: I know, and I love you for it.

dialogues.speaker: ROSE
dialogues.text: No, you don't.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Yes, I do. Rose moves away from Tom and starts for the exit.

dialogues.speaker: ROSE
dialogues.text: If Elizabeth doesn't come he's sleeping on the couch and Hannah's sleeping in here.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: No, he said Elizabeth was coming.

dialogues.speaker: ROSE
dialogues.text: She is?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The patio is sparsely furnished, used mostly for storage. Rose covers a small sofa with a sheet and some blankets. pulls a pillow case onto a pillow. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca

dialogues.speaker: ROSE
dialogues.text: If Neil doesn't like sleeping out here he can go stay at a hotel. I am not putting Hannah out here. I told her she could stay with us before I knew Neil was coming.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Don't worry, he'll love it.

dialogues.speaker: ROSE
dialogues.text: What does Neil do? Does he work?

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: I'm not sure. Jacob didn't say.

dialogues.speaker: ROSE
dialogues.text: Did he ever finish college?

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: I'm not sure about that either. Rose rolls her eyes as she tucks the final corner of bedd into the sofa.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rose vacuums.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom enters, pulls a full bag of garbage out of the trash and exits to the patio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Tom exits outside with the garbage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom drags the trash cans to the street and goes back insi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom and Rose lie in bed.

dialogues.speaker: ROSE
dialogues.text: Don't you think it would be more fun to go to Essex Canyon then the beach?

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Yeah, sure. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca

dialogues.speaker: ROSE
dialogues.text: It's too cold this time of year to go to the beach.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: That's a good point.

dialogues.speaker: ROSE
dialogues.text: Maybe we can all go to church on Sunday.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Yeah, that'd be fun. Silence. Darkness.

dialogues.speaker: ROSE
dialogues.text: Tom?

dialogues.speaker: ROSE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: ROSE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Do you think I'm a bitch?

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: No, of course not. I love you. Tom kisses Rose.

dialogues.speaker: ROSE
dialogues.text: I mean, I don't want you to think I hate all your friends.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: I don't.

dialogues.speaker: ROSE
dialogues.text: I don't hate Neil, he's just such a... loser. And if Jacob weren't such a self-centered, egomaniac...

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Yeah, but there's something about the guy you just got to like.

dialogues.speaker: ROSE
dialogues.text: I don't have the vaguest idea what that might be. He's just so full of himself. He needs to get a life. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: He's got a life.

dialogues.speaker: ROSE
dialogues.text: Who knows, maybe he's grown up a little since we last saw him.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Probably not. Rose moves toward Tom.

dialogues.speaker: ROSE
dialogues.text: Tom?

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: ROSE
dialogues.text: I'm ovulating tonight. Tom smiles and Rose kisses Tom and moves on top of him an they make love and... Tom climaxes and... Rose rolls off him.

dialogues.speaker: ROSE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Did he say what time he would be getting here?

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: ROSE
dialogues.text: Jacob... and Elizabeth.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: I don't know, they're flying and they got to rent a car and stuff. I guess around noon. Tom's eyes wander shut.

dialogues.speaker: ROSE
dialogues.text: What time is Neil getting here?

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: (starting to fall asleep) Who knows. Rose stares at the ceiling, finally says: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca

dialogues.speaker: ROSE
dialogues.text: Tom?

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: (drifting off) Hum?

dialogues.speaker: ROSE
dialogues.text: I'm glad we stayed in Bowie. I wouldn't want to live in New York even if you were going to make twice as much money as Jacob. I mean, aren't you glad we stayed?

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Yeah, of course.

dialogues.speaker: ROSE
dialogues.text: New York is no place to raise a family. And people in big cites are so cold and... hard. You can't trust'em with a dime. (and) I guess I just kind of like it here.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: (asleep) Me... too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The house sits in the darkness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A lone cyclist rides along the road: NEIL ZISKE. His thin, muscular legs effortlessly propel the bicycle forward. Neil (29) looks a few years younger than either Tom or Ro Wind blows through his short black hair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Neil peddles past the "Welcome to Bowie: population si

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neil continues, and the landscape becomes increasingly ur He turns onto Main Street. Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He keeps riding. He's alone. It's still early.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Neil rides up in front of the store and stops. He gets off his bike... walks to the front window... stares in fo moment... returns to his bike and peddles away...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Neil turns off into a neighborhood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neil slowly peddles through the neighborhood. He turns into the Newman driveway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rose and Tom sleep. A KNOCK, KNOCK, KNOCK can be heard off screen. Rose and Tom still sleep. More KNOCKING and Tom starts to wake up and Rose, too. Th look at each other.

dialogues.speaker: ROSE/TOM
dialogues.text: Neil!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom opens the door and looks out but Neil's not there.

dialogues.speaker: NEIL, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Hey- man, what's up? Neil sits on the front lawn stretching out. Tom sees him.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Neil... what are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: I'm stretching out- man, trying to keep the lactose acid from building up. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: But it's six o'clock in the morning.

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: I know, I've been riding all night. Neil grabs his bag and bounds into the house. NEIL (CONT’D) I think I found the new way to get here from San Francisco.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rose prepares a pot of coffee. Neil and Tom enter.

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: Hey, Rose.

dialogues.speaker: ROSE
dialogues.text: Hello Neil.

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: It's good to see you.

dialogues.speaker: ROSE
dialogues.text: How have you been?

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: Good... Neil hugs Rose. She reluctantly hugs him back.

dialogues.speaker: ROSE
dialogues.text: I've got to get ready. Show Neil where he's staying. Rose exits. Neil grabs a banana as they exit the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: You guys got any Kiwi fruit? To replace the selenium I lost?

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Sorry, I just ate the last one before you got here. Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  10.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Tom and Neil enter.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: I hope this is alright. It's just... we already told Hannah she could stay, so this is the only place left.

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: No need to apologize, man. This is great. Just give me a couple of blankets and I'll be fine. Neil surveys the patio as he chomps on his banana. He thr his bag onto the sofa. CLOSE - A WOMAN'S WATCH READS: 11:00 a.m.

dialogues.speaker: ROSE, (0.S)
dialogues.text: She should have been here by now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Rose looks at her watch, pacing back and forth. She's dressed now. Tom sits on the couch.

dialogues.speaker: ROSE
dialogues.text: I wonder if-- But the off screen sound of a car silences Rose. She dart for the front door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A TAN '67 VOLVO STATION WAGON pulls into the driveway. Th driver, HANNAH JOHNSON, gets out of the car and... the front door swings open and Rose runs down the steps toward the driveway and... Hannah sees Rose approaching and her arms open up and the share a huge hug.

dialogues.speaker: HANNAH
dialogues.text: Bear!

dialogues.speaker: ROSE
dialogues.text: Pan! (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  11.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: And they're laughing now as they hug.

dialogues.speaker: ROSE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I can't believe it! Rose steps back to get a better look at Hannah. Rose Look at you... Hannah's long, blonde hair glows and her clean face shine without any make-up. Her "artsy" clothes hang off her bod concealing what could potentially be a very attractive figure.

dialogues.speaker: HANNAH
dialogues.text: What, you don't like it?

dialogues.speaker: ROSE
dialogues.text: No, it's not that, it's just... it's different.

dialogues.speaker: HANNAH
dialogues.text: I told you I'd changed. Tom approaches from the porch.

dialogues.speaker: ROSE
dialogues.text: I know I- I just didn't quite envision it like this.

dialogues.speaker: HANNAH
dialogues.text: You don't like it. Hannah smiles, and when she smiles her whole face lights

dialogues.speaker: ROSE
dialogues.text: No I like it... Really. And they share another terrific hug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Rose and Hannah enter.

dialogues.speaker: ROSE
dialogues.text: You're on the couch. Neil's staying out there.

dialogues.speaker: HANNAH
dialogues.text: Neil? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  12.

dialogues.speaker: ROSE
dialogues.text: You remember... Jacob's basketball friend? Tom enters carrying Hannah's bag and a guitar.

dialogues.speaker: HANNAH
dialogues.text: Oh, yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neil sits in a wicker chair reading. Hannah pokes her head into the patio, says:

dialogues.speaker: HANNAH
dialogues.text: I guess we're going to be neighbors. Neil looks up from his reading and immediately recognizes Hannah.

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: Hey, Hannah.

dialogues.speaker: HANNAH
dialogues.text: You actually... remember me?

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: What are you crazy? Of course. Fifth period. Mr. Morton's Lit class. Neil and Hannah laugh as they speak together:

dialogues.speaker: NEIL/HANNAH
dialogues.text: "Sin is a demon crouching at the door. It shall be eager for you, and you will be mastered by it, but you must master it." And they continue to laugh as Rose enters.

dialogues.speaker: ROSE
dialogues.text: What was that?

dialogues.speaker: HANNAH
dialogues.text: It was Mr. Morton. He made us memorize that quote for every test.

dialogues.speaker: ROSE
dialogues.text: Why? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  13.

dialogues.speaker: HANNAH
dialogues.text: It's a long story. Hannah looks at Neil, he nods.

dialogues.speaker: ROSE
dialogues.text: Come on, I want to give you the tour.

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: See you later, Hannah. Hannah turns back and smiles at Neil as she disappears in the house. Tom slowly enters.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: So... what are you reading? Neil holds the book up. It's a bible.

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: It's the word of God, man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rose and Hannah enter.

dialogues.speaker: ROSE
dialogues.text: (pointing to the counters) We're going to have all this redone this summer.

dialogues.speaker: HANNAH
dialogues.text: Is Jacob staying here, too?

dialogues.speaker: ROSE
dialogues.text: Unfortunately. Rose moves further into the kitchen. Hannah follows.

dialogues.speaker: HANNAH
dialogues.text: Why didn't you tell me?

dialogues.speaker: ROSE
dialogues.text: What's to tell? You know Tom is his best friend. Where else would he be staying? Rose moves to the window.

dialogues.speaker: ROSE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We're going to have a bay window put in over here. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  14.

dialogues.speaker: HANNAH
dialogues.text: Forget the bay window! What about Jacob?

dialogues.speaker: ROSE
dialogues.text: What about him? He's married. And he's still a jerk.

dialogues.speaker: HANNAH
dialogues.text: But it's "Jacob Barrett." Remember?

dialogues.speaker: ROSE
dialogues.text: You can't possibly still have a crush on him?

dialogues.speaker: HANNAH
dialogues.text: I- I don't know. I really hadn't thought much about him until- until just now. You never think about him?

dialogues.speaker: ROSE
dialogues.text: The thought of that egotistical, self-centered... asshole makes my blood boil. I didn't even want him to stay here.

dialogues.speaker: HANNAH
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: ROSE
dialogues.text: --Really.

dialogues.speaker: HANNAH
dialogues.text: You never told Tom about you and-- Horrified, Rose moves closer to Hannah to make sure no on listening.

dialogues.speaker: ROSE
dialogues.text: (interrupting) --No, and I'm not going to. God, it's embarrassing it ever happened. It was such a mistake.

dialogues.speaker: HANNAH
dialogues.text: Maybe you're lucky you got him out of your system... "Bear."

dialogues.speaker: ROSE
dialogues.text: (half mad, half laughing) Don't call me that. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  15.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: They both start laughing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neil and Tom sit in the patio furniture. Tom glances at h watch.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Did jacob say what time he was going to be here?

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: No. Tom nods and they sit in silence and Neil starts to read bible.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: So what have you been up to?

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: Serving the Lord, man.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Does the lord pay your bills?

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: He can. But I've been ridding a rickshaw around San Francisco.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: --One of those bikes with a carriage behind it?

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: --Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Do you like it?

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: Yeah, it's a pretty good set up, for the most part. I just try and stay on top of the managers to keep the bikes maintained. Tom glances at this watch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rose and Hannah are seated at the kitchen table drinking coffee. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  16.

dialogues.speaker: ROSE
dialogues.text: I hate-- no, I don't hate, I feel sorry for her. She is such a wonderful person.

dialogues.speaker: HANNAH
dialogues.text: What's she like?

dialogues.speaker: ROSE
dialogues.text: I wish you knew her. It's just so hard working for someone like her. But enough about me. Tell me about you. Are you seeing anyone?

dialogues.speaker: HANNAH
dialogues.text: .-.-I'm dating.

dialogues.speaker: ROSE
dialogues.text: I'm glad I got those days out of the way in high school. Is it anything serious?

dialogues.speaker: HANNAH
dialogues.text: No... not really.

dialogues.speaker: ROSE
dialogues.text: Is that what you want?

dialogues.speaker: HANNAH
dialogues.text: Yeah, right now I think it is. I'm just concentrating on my music.

dialogues.speaker: ROSE
dialogues.text: You are so good. You're going to be the next Tori Amos. Hannah blushes.

dialogues.speaker: HANNAH
dialogues.text: I finally feel like I'm choosing music, instead of it choosing me, you know? I always felt like I retreated to my guitar because I was alone or- or didn't have a boyfriend. But now, I've got "boyfriends" and- and I've still got my guitar, too.

dialogues.speaker: ROSE
dialogues.text: You're going to find someone and you're going to be so happy. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  17.

dialogues.speaker: HANNAH
dialogues.text: Maybe. They sip their coffee.

dialogues.speaker: HANNAH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It looks like you're really happy here.

dialogues.speaker: ROSE
dialogues.text: I am- I mean we are.

dialogues.speaker: HANNAH
dialogues.text: You guys thinking about starting a family?

dialogues.speaker: ROSE
dialogues.text: Yeah, we both want to have lots of children. I thought I was pregnant last month but it was just a false alarm. Tom's sperm count is a little low. The doctor says it's nothing to worry about, we just got to keep trying.

dialogues.speaker: HANNAH
dialogues.text: That could be fun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACOB BARRET drives. His wife, ELIZABETH sits in the passenger seat.

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH
dialogues.text: I just hate the way you act when you're around them. Of course she's beautiful, she's the former homecoming qu fake blonde hair, a thick coat of make-up covering her fa and the best clothes that money can buy.

dialogues.speaker: JACOB
dialogues.text: Quit your complaining. It'll be good for us to be out of the city for a while... Let us unwind a little... Relax. Jacob may not be as beautiful as Elizabeth, but what he l in beauty he makes up for in pure ego.

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH
dialogues.text: I don't see why we couldn't just stay at a hotel. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  18.

dialogues.speaker: JACOB
dialogues.text: Because I said so, okay? Elizabeth pulls out a cigarette and lights it.

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH
dialogues.text: You just want to fuck Rose again.

dialogues.speaker: JACOB
dialogues.text: Shut the fuck up. If I wanted to get laid, I could get laid, just like in high school, no matter what hotel we stayed in. Elizabeth sucks on her cigarette.

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH
dialogues.text: And what, you don't think I could? Jacob glares at Elizabeth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Jacob's DELUXE HERTZ RENTAL CAR pulls into the drivewa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacob stares at Elizabeth. Jacob hits the horn. HONK! And the second that Tom appears on the porch Jacob wipes scowl off his face and replaces it with a warm, almost sincere smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom moves toward the driveway. Neil appears on the porch followed by Hannah and Rose. Jacob gets out of the car and yells:

dialogues.speaker: JACOB
dialogues.text: Shit, you didn't tell me you lived in a mansion! Tom gets to Jacob and they shake hands. Jacob's superior size becomes quite obvious standing next to Tom.

dialogues.speaker: JACOB, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: This your place? Tom nods. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  19.

dialogues.speaker: JACOB, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Shit, it's great.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Yeah, we like it.

dialogues.speaker: JACOB
dialogues.text: Fuck, yeah. And now Neil arrives at the car.

dialogues.speaker: JACOB, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Neil, you fucking jock.

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: What's up, man? Jacob slaps Neil on the back and they share a hug. NEIL (CONT’D) Hey Elizabeth. How's it going? Elizabeth is still in the car smoking her cigarette. She smiles at Neil-- sort of. Jacob throws his arms around Neil and Tom, and leads them toward the house.

dialogues.speaker: AT THE PORCH
dialogues.text: the "boys" move into the house, passing Rose and Hannah.

dialogues.speaker: JACOB
dialogues.text: Hello RoseMarie.

dialogues.speaker: ROSE
dialogues.text: --Jacob.

dialogues.speaker: JACOB
dialogues.text: Thanks for putting us up. It's going to be a fucking blast.

dialogues.speaker: ROSE
dialogues.text: Where else would you stay? You remember Hannah? Hannah steps forward and extends her hand and Jacob shake her hand but he doesn't remember her.

dialogues.speaker: JACOB
dialogues.text: Yeah... of course. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  20.

dialogues.speaker: HANNAH
dialogues.text: Fifth period English... Mr. Morton? "Sin is a demon... crouching... at the door." Jacob stares blankly at Hannah.

dialogues.speaker: JACOB
dialogues.text: You sat... over by the window?

dialogues.speaker: HANNAH
dialogues.text: Close. I sat near the door, right next to you.

dialogues.speaker: JACOB
dialogues.text: --Oh?

dialogues.speaker: HANNAH
dialogues.text: Pimples... and glasses... and braces? Jacob laughs a little and looks at the others, not sure i she's serious or not.

dialogues.speaker: JACOB
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, I mean, I'm surprised I don 't--

dialogues.speaker: HANNAH
dialogues.text: (interrupting) --It's alright. There's not much to remember.

dialogues.speaker: ROSE
dialogues.text: Don't worry, you'll remember. Tom, take him in and show him his room. Rose pushes Tom forward.

dialogues.speaker: ROSE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (continuing) You're staying in the guest room.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Come on. The "boys" go into the house. Elizabeth struggles with several suit cases as she climbs porch steps. She smiles as she passes Rose, a cigarette dangling out of her mouth. Hannah holds the door open. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.text: So is Wall Street as crazy as everyone says it is?

It's an offering of free will, and it's about individual responsibility and the invention of consciousness. And that's what Morton was talking about. He was trying to tell us that we had a choice, and not just between good and evil, but with everything. Tom repeats the word back to himself:

dialogues.text: I don't want this to end like it did in high school, but it's got to end. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  99.

dialogues.speaker: JACOB
dialogues.text: The timing is all wrong. Me and Elizabeth, I guess we're just going through something. I hope I didn't mislead you. Rose takes a deep breath and starts to speak but her voic cracks and she stops and takes another deep breath. She starts to speak again and her voice continues to crac but she keeps going anyway, and she's fighting back tears

dialogues.speaker: ROSE
dialogues.text: No- no, I- I don't care. We're not kids anymore. I guess me and Tom are going through something, too. Our relationship is- is so strong, you and Elizabeth could never understand what me and Tom have...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finished with her own clothes, Elizabeth throws Jacob's clothes into another suitcase.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom and Neil still sit on the couch. Hannah still sits across from them.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: What does the bible say about this?

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: A lot. (and) Come on Tom, take my hand and pray with me. Tom takes Neil's hand. NEIL (CONT’D) Do you want to be born again? Right now? Tom takes a deep breath and nods, "yes." Neil closes his eyes but Tom's eyes remain open and fastened to Hannah an Neil takes a deep breathe and starts to speak but Hannah interrupts. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  100.

dialogues.speaker: HANNAH
dialogues.text: (interrupting) Timshel... Hannah's word hangs in the air and Tom's looking right at her.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: --What? Hannah gets up and starts moving toward Tom and Neil.

dialogues.speaker: HANNAH
dialogues.text: Don't. Don't just retreat to religion.

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: Knock it off, Hannah. He needs our support. He needs the Lord. Hannah sits on the couch. Tom now sits between Neil and Hannah.

dialogues.speaker: HANNAH
dialogues.text: This is what Morton was talking about! "Timshel."

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: --Hannah, this is not the time.

dialogues.speaker: HANNAH
dialogues.text: Tom, you got to choose for yourself. You don't have to do what Neil says. You don't have to do what Rose says. You don't have to do what your parents said. You should do what you want.

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: Hannah, please.

dialogues.speaker: HANNAH
dialogues.text: (to Neil) If God exists, fine, but let him find out for himself.

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: Hannah, you said you respected me. I just want him to do the same thing. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  101.

dialogues.speaker: HANNAH
dialogues.text: But for you it's different, for you it's a choice. You're choosing for Tom.

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: --But we're going to be doing the same thing.

dialogues.speaker: HANNAH
dialogues.text: No, it's not. If two people do the same thing for different reasons, it's not the same thing. Neil thinks for a moment, staring at Hannah.

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: But then he's just doing what you say. How's that any different?

dialogues.speaker: HANNAH
dialogues.text: Maybe it's not, maybe it's a paradox. But maybe trying is all anyone can do. And the door opens and Rose appears in the doorway. Elizabeth enters with the suitcases and exits out the fro door without saying a word.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elizabeth exits the house, walks to Jacob's car. Jacob st sits in the drivers seat. He watches as Elizabeth approaches.

dialogues.speaker: JACOB
dialogues.text: Well?

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH
dialogues.text: Well what? Open the trunk. Jacob pops the trunk. Elizabeth throws the suitcases into the trunk and gets into the car.

dialogues.speaker: JACOB
dialogues.text: You know, this is as much their fault as it is ours. Elizabeth stares hatefully at Jacob.

dialogues.speaker: JACOB, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Shit! (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  102.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Jacob starts the engine, backs the car out of the drivewa and they drive away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom and Rose sit at the table. Finally Rose speaks.

dialogues.speaker: ROSE
dialogues.text: He hasn't changed one bit. How could we let him stay here?

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: ROSE
dialogues.text: Tom, I made a mistake. I think we both made a mistake and- and I want to be the first one to apologize.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Do you love him?

dialogues.speaker: ROSE
dialogues.text: No, of course not.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: So- so what do you want to do?

dialogues.speaker: ROSE
dialogues.text: We've been together for so long. I think what we have is too valuable to just throw away without even trying. Tom inhales deeply and stares at Rose.

dialogues.speaker: ROSE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Tom, talk to me, tell me how you're feeling. We've both been on an emotional rollercoaster this weekend. This isn't going to just go away but- but maybe we can grow beyond it. Maybe? And tears start to grow in Rose's eyes. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  103.

dialogues.speaker: ROSE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (continuing) I mean, we could go on and punish ourselves for what we've done, but I just feel like I want to go back to the way things were before any of this, before this God-awful weekend. Tom sighs, says:

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Me, too. Rose covers Tom's hand with her own and now she's crying.

dialogues.speaker: ROSE
dialogues.text: Most people don't have half of what we have. I mean, I know Jacob and Elizabeth will never even be close. And we were willing to throw it all away. And for what?

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: ROSE
dialogues.text: I love you, Tom. And at least now I know, if Jacob were to make a pass at me now, I would be able to turn him down, and- and maybe it's the same for you with Elizabeth? Tom Nods. Rose waits for an answer.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: It is. Rose wipes the tears out of her eyes and they embrace.

dialogues.speaker: ROSE
dialogues.text: (crying) Are we going to this God-damn reunion? Tom nods and hugs Rose back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rose and Tom enter, holding hands. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  104.

dialogues.speaker: ROSE
dialogues.text: We're going to the reunion. Together. Neil and Hannah glance at each other.

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: Well, that's great. See, man, I told you could work things out. Neil slaps Tom on the arm. Tom smiles faintly but doesn't look at Hannah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rose enters, a towel wrapped around her body, hair wet.

dialogues.speaker: ROSE
dialogues.text: Why aren't you getting ready? Tom sits on the bed.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: I will.

dialogues.speaker: ROSE
dialogues.text: We got to leave in ten minutes.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: I know. Rose moves to the closet and begins to get dressed.

dialogues.speaker: ROSE
dialogues.text: I'm so glad they left. Rose starts to put on her dress. She looks at herself in mirror.

dialogues.speaker: ROSE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Do you think this dress makes me look fat? Tom doesn't answer. He's still sitting on the bed.

dialogues.speaker: ROSE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Tom? Why aren't you getting ready?

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: I am. Tom starts to untie one of his shoes. Rose goes back to putting on her dress. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  105.

dialogues.speaker: ROSE
dialogues.text: Why didn't you tell me Jacob offered you a job in New York?

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: I- I guess I didn't have time.

dialogues.speaker: ROSE
dialogues.text: He says New York is pretty nice. I don't think it's like other cities. Maybe we should go to New York. I mean, it'd be a lot more money. Tom stops fiddling with his shoe and looks at Rose with s real surprise.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: You- you want to go to New York?

dialogues.speaker: ROSE
dialogues.text: Maybe. I think we should definitely think about it. Rose looks at Tom. He's still sitting on the bed looking back at her.

dialogues.speaker: ROSE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What's wrong?

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: If we had wanted to go to New York, we should have gone 10 years ago. I thought we wanted to stay here.

dialogues.speaker: ROSE
dialogues.text: You don't want to go to New York?

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: That's not the point. I- I don't know what I want... I want to find out what I want.

dialogues.speaker: ROSE
dialogues.text: Maybe that's something we need to work on, but I don't think that's any reason to pass up this opportunity. Tom remains on the bed.

dialogues.speaker: ROSE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Do you? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  106.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Tom shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: ROSE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We'll talk about this later. Tom stands up and starts to walk toward the door.

dialogues.speaker: ROSE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Tom! Where are you going?

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: I haven't any idea. Tom freezes and looks at Rose and tries to gather his strength.

dialogues.speaker: TOM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I- I'm not going. Maybe if I hurry I can make it to the twentieth reunion.

dialogues.speaker: ROSE
dialogues.text: Tom, wait a minute. How was I supposed to know what New York was like? I've never been there either. I didn't know. Tom looks blankly at Rose.

dialogues.speaker: ROSE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Well? How was I supposed to know? Just tell me how I was supposed to know? I don't see what you're getting so upset about.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: I'm not upset.

dialogues.speaker: ROSE
dialogues.text: Well, then how can you leave? I think you owe me a little more than that. I thought we were going to try and make this work?

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: (trying to clear his throat) ... Timshel.

dialogues.speaker: ROSE
dialogues.text: What? And now Tom says it louder and it hits Rose hard: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  107.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Timshel! And the word seems to physically stop Rose.

dialogues.speaker: ROSE
dialogues.text: What the hell is that supposed to mean?

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: I don't know. And Tom exits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neil and Hannah watch as Tom passes through.

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: Where are you going? Tom gets to the door and looks back at Neil and Hannah.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: I don't know. Tom exits. Hannah looks at Neil and then runs into the hallway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rose lies on the bed, crying. Hannah enters and sits on t bed, and wraps her arm around Rose and Rose's crying increases.

dialogues.speaker: HANNAH
dialogues.text: Oh, Rose, I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rose sleeps. Hannah gets up and kisses Rose on the forehe and exits.

dialogues.speaker: ROSE
dialogues.text: Goodnight. Rose breathes deeply, sleeps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neil waits on the couch. Hannah enters. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  108.

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: Ready? Hannah nods and Neil gets up and they exit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neil and Hannah exit the house and walk to the Volvo and in and drive off to the reunion. FADE OUT.

dialogues.speaker: THE END
dialogues.text: Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca
